contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Michael Gorman (disambiguation)}} '''Michael A. Gorman''' (July 9, 1950 â€“ December 2, 2012) was a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] representing the state's third House district, including constituents in [[Craven County, North Carolina|Craven]] and [[Pamlico County, North Carolina|Pamlico]] counties, from 2003-2004. Gorman was born in [[New Jersey]], graduated from the [[United States Naval Academy]], served in the [[United States Navy]] with service during [[Vietnam War]] and retired as [[Lieutenant Commander]] after 24 years of service.<ref>http://www.newbernsj.com/news/local/former-trent-woods-mayor-legislator-dies-1.60195</ref> Gorman operated a business in [[Morehead City, North Carolina|Morehead City]] and then in [[Trent Woods, North Carolina]]. He lost a primary challenge in 2004, and lost another primary in 2006. He also served as mayor of Trent Woods.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.carolinajournal.com/exclusives/display_exclusive.html?id=1907 |title=A NC House Election Checklist |publisher=www.carolinajournal.com |accessdate=2010-12-12 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.carolinajournal.com/exclusives/display_exclusive.html?id=3557 |title=Homestretch in the House Races |publisher=www.carolinajournal.com |accessdate=2010-12-12 }}</ref> He died of [[POEMS syndrome]] in 2012.<ref>[http://obits.nj.com/obituaries/jerseyjournal/obituary.aspx?pid=161513928#fbLoggedOut]</ref><ref>[http://www.newbernsj.com/news/local/former-trent-woods-mayor-legislator-dies-1.60195 Obituary]</ref><ref>[http://www.covenantfuneralservice.com/obituaries/michael-a-gorman/]</ref> ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Gorman, Michael A. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1950 | PLACE OF BIRTH = New Jersey | DATE OF DEATH = 2012 | PLACE OF DEATH = Fredericksburg, Virginia }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gorman, Michael A.}} [[Category:Mayors of places in North Carolina]] [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:People from Craven County, North Carolina]] [[Category:People from Carteret County, North Carolina]] [[Category:United States Navy personnel]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War]] [[Category:United States Naval Academy alumni]] [[Category:Neurological disease deaths in the United States]] [[Category:2012 deaths]] [[Category:1950 births]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
